Michael Hedaitulla

Software Developer & Computer Nerd

Who I am

I made my first site when I was at the tender age of 13.
Ever since then, I've been constantly striving to improve my skills.

Software development is my driving passion and everything in my life is affected by it, life decisions are based upon it.
Realize great things is what makes me satisfied, and when others use it, is awesome.

I'm a lifelong learner, automation enthusiast, DevOps lover and Mobile Developer with an eye on design.
Away from develop things, I love beer, eating everything and playing every sports, especially snowboard.

What I do


Software Developement

Build and deploy desktop and mobile applications.


Web Developement

Build and design responsive websites.


Backend Developement

Maintain a backend to power applications and websites.


Graphic Design

Create icons and various graphics for development.

The three chief virtues of a programmer are: Laziness, Impatience and Hubris.

~ Larry Wall

Virtues of a programmer

Ultimately, it means I can make a career out of laziness, impatience, and hubris.

  • 01. Laziness
  • 02. Impatience
  • 03. Hubris

I'm too lazy to do the same task repeatedly, so I write scripts to automate a task for me.
This makes people think I am intelligent.


I'm too impatient to wait for my code to run so rewrite the code to improve performance.
This makes people think I am a good programmer.


When someone asks if I can do something I just say 'yes', then find out how to do it (StackOverflow).
This makes people think I can do anything.
